name: Slack Bench v2 (Combined)
description: Combined benchmark: v1 tests + LLM-generated hard tests

tests.name: Send message to general channel
tests.prompt: Send a 'hello' message to the general channel

tests.name: Send direct message
tests.prompt: Send a DM to John saying 'Can we sync later?'

tests.name: Send direct message Artem, and Hubert (Create group conversation + send message)
tests.prompt: Send a DM (group conversation not channel) to Artem and Hubert saying 'Hey, I've took a look at the presentation and I have some questions. Can you help me?'

message_text.contains: presentation and I have some questions

tests.name: Create a new channel
tests.prompt: Create a new channel called 'rl-project'

tests.name: Add user to channel
tests.prompt: Add Morgan Stanley to the 'random' channel

tests.name: Create a new channel and add user to it
tests.prompt: Create a new channel called 'rl-project' and add Morgan Stanley to it

tests.name: Remove user from channel
tests.prompt: Remove John from the #random channel

tests.name: Archive a channel
tests.prompt: Archive the #growth channel

tests.name: Reply in a thread
tests.prompt: Reply 'Next monday.' to the most recent message in #general

tests.name: Reply in a thread
tests.prompt: Reply 'Next monday.' to the to MCP deployment questions in #general

tests.name: Add emoji reaction
tests.prompt: React with :thumbsup: to the question about lunch in #random

tests.name: Add emoji reaction
tests.prompt: React with :thumbsup: to the most recent posted message in #general

tests.name: Update channel topic
tests.prompt: Change the #general channel topic to 'Weekly standup discussions'

tests.name: Edit existing message
tests.prompt: Find the message that says 'Hey team' and edit it to say 'Hello everyone'

tests.name: Mention user in message
tests.prompt: Post to #general mentioning Artem with text 'Please review the pull request'

tests.name: Multi-channel send
tests.prompt: Send 'System maintenance tonight at 10pm' to both #general and #random

tests.name: Delete old message
tests.prompt: Delete the message about new feature you posted in #general

tests.name: Forward messages to another channel
tests.prompt: Copy the two questions from #random and post them both to #general

tests.name: Search messages in a channel and combine results into a new message as DM
tests.prompt: Search for all messages (4 messages) in the #engineering channel related to login issues and combine them into a single new message as DM to Hubert. Do not change the meaning of the original messages just combine them.

tests.name: Search messages in multiple channels and combine results into a new message as DM
tests.prompt: Search for all messages (6 messages) related to login issues and auth improvments. Combine them into a single new message as DM to Hubert. Do not change the meaning of the original messages just combine them.

tests.name: Search messages in multiple channels and edit message in a channel with the combined results
tests.prompt: Search for all messages (6 messages) related to login issues and auth improvments. Edit the message in the #engineering channel you sent before without details about issues and add the details about the issues and improvements. Do not change the meaning/ woring of the original messages just combine them.

tests.name: Edit a thread message
tests.prompt: You've replied to one of the messages with a bad joke. Edit it, for 'I will make a proposal for auth improvements tommorow EOD'

to.contains: proposal for auth improvements tommorow EOD

tests.name: Rich Text: Basic Formatting (Bold/Italic)
tests.prompt: Send a message to #general saying 'Attention' in bold and 'check logs' in italics. Use Slack Block Kit rich_text blocks with style attributes (bold:true, italic:true).

tests.name: Rich Text: Bulleted List
tests.prompt: Send a bulleted list to #random with three items: 'Bagels', 'Coffee', and 'Donuts'. Use Slack Block Kit rich_text blocks with rich_text_list (style:bullet).

tests.name: Rich Text: Code Block and Numbered List
tests.prompt: Do two things using Slack Block Kit: 1) Send a code snippet to #engineering containing `{"status": 200}` using rich_text_preformatted element, and 2) Send a numbered list to #general with items 'Phase 1' and 'Phase 2' using rich_text_list with style:ordered.

tests.name: Rich Text: Block Quote
tests.prompt: Quote the text 'To be or not to be' in the #random channel. Use Slack Block Kit rich_text blocks with rich_text_quote element.

tests.name: Table Block Generation
tests.prompt: Send a table to #growth with headers 'Metric' and 'Value', and one row of data: 'DAU', '1500'. Use Slack Block Kit with a table block type.

tests.name: Markdown Block (Direct)
tests.prompt: Send a markdown formatted message to #engineering with a header 'Daily Report' and a bold item '**All Systems Go**'. Use Slack Block Kit with a markdown block type.

tests.name: Rich Text: User Mention
tests.prompt: Mention @Artem in #general using Slack Block Kit rich_text blocks with a user element type containing Artem's user ID.

tests.name: Chained Reasoning: Search and DM
tests.prompt: Find the user who complained about 'captcha' in #general and send them a DM saying 'I am looking into this.'

tests.name: Set Operations: Group Invite based on Topic
tests.prompt: Create a new channel called 'auth-force' and invite everyone who has posted about 'login' or 'password'.

tests.name: Constraint Verification (Negative Test)
tests.prompt: Try to invite the user 'ElonMusk' to #general. If you can't find him, inform me (Hubert) via Slack.

tests.name: Information Synthesis
tests.prompt: Who are the admins of the 'Test Workspace'? Reply with their names in #random.

tests.name: Ambiguity Resolution (Contextual User)
tests.prompt: Invite the Morgan who is NOT an admin to #random.

tests.name: Ambiguity Resolution (Contextual Channel)
tests.prompt: Post 'Status update: Alpha is on track' to the alpha dev channel.

tests.name: Cross-channel Summarization
tests.prompt: Summarize the discussion about 'Gemini' in #random and post the summary to #engineering.

tests.name: Conditional Logic
tests.prompt: Check the discussion in #growth. If the team decided to double down on Reddit, react with :rocket: to the message proposing it.

tests.name: Open Source Hackathon Coordination
tests.prompt:
Hey, I need your help coordinating our 24-hour global hackathon across Lagos, Kyiv, Warsaw, and SF. First, can you find out which channels are relevant for this open source hackathon we're running? I want to make sure #core-infra has an updated topic that reflects we're in hackathon mode.

Also, I need to post an update to the infrastructure team about our coordination status. Before I loop in Łukasz Kowalski and Kenji Sato, can you pull up their profiles? I want to confirm Łukasz is still our performance lead and check Kenji's role on the APAC growth side.

I posted something outdated in one of the channels yesterday that needs to be removed - it had wrong timezone info. Can you also check what's been discussed recently in #project-alpha-dev so I'm caught up? And verify who's currently in #frontend - we might need to add some people.

Oh, and when you find any important messages about the hackathon prep, just give them a thumbs up so people know we've seen them.

_step_sequence.action: Set channel topic about Open Source Hackathon Coordination

_step_sequence.justification: Share findings or coordinate with team

_step_sequence.action: Discover channels related to Open Source Hackathon Coordination
_step_sequence.justification: Need to find relevant channels before coordinating
Verify their role in APAC growth
Verify the right people are involved

tests.name: Diwali x Thanksgiving Potluck
tests.prompt:
Hey, I need some help organizing our Diwali x Thanksgiving potluck celebration! We're doing a combined Indian and American traditions thing and I want to make sure we coordinate this properly across the team.

First, can you check what channels we have that might be relevant for this event and see what's been discussed recently in #core-infra? I want to make sure I'm not stepping on any ongoing conversations. Also, I need to know who's on our team so I can figure out who to involve based on their backgrounds and expertise.

Once you've got that context, please update the topics for #core-infra, #project-alpha, and #growth to reflect that we're planning this potluck celebration. Then post an announcement in #project-alpha about the event.

I also need you to check who's currently in #growth to make sure the right people are included, and open a direct message with Kenji Sato since I need to coordinate with him separately about timing given APAC schedules.

Oh, and there's an old message I posted earlier about the event that has wrong details - can you update it with the correct information? There's also an outdated announcement from last week that's no longer relevant, so please delete that. Finally, just react to Priya's message about bringing samosas to show I've seen it!

_step_sequence.justification: Share findings or coordinate with team

_step_sequence.action: Set channel topic about Diwali x Thanksgiving Potluck
Set channel topic about Diwali x Thanksgiving Potluck
Update a previous message with new info
Discover channels related to Diwali x Thanksgiving Potluck
_step_sequence.justification: Need to find relevant channels before coordinating

_step_sequence.action: Set channel topic about Diwali x Thanksgiving Potluck
Discover channels related to Diwali x Thanksgiving Potluck
_step_sequence.justification: Need to find relevant channels before coordinating

tests.name: Lunar New Year Product Launch
tests.prompt:
Hey, I need some help getting our Lunar New Year product launch coordination sorted out. We're targeting APAC markets and I want to make sure we're being culturally sensitive with our timing and messaging.

First, can you help me figure out who on our team has the right expertise for this? I need to reach out directly to our frontend person about some UI elements that need to be adapted, and also connect with our engineering lead separately about the technical rollout schedule.

Also, I noticed the #project-alpha-dev channel might have some people who aren't really needed for this particular launch, and I want to keep discussions focused. Can you check who's currently in that channel? We may need to streamline the membership a bit - I think there are a couple of folks who were added for previous projects but don't need to be looped in on the APAC launch details.

_step_sequence.justification: Identify who to involve based on expertise
Identify who to involve based on expertise
Verify the right people are involved

tests.name: Music Festival Tech Stack
tests.prompt:
Hey, I need some help cleaning up our Afrobeats festival streaming project workspace. We've had some organizational issues lately. First, can you find out who's currently hanging out in #random and also get me a list of everyone on the team? I need to verify Robert Chen's role since he's supposed to be leading the engineering side of things.

I also need you to dig through our CDN-related conversations - we had some important discussions about our content delivery setup that I need to reference. Check what's been happening recently in #project-alpha too.

Once you've got the lay of the land, please remove Artem Bogdanov from #project-alpha-dev and also kick Hubert Marek from #core-infra - they've moved to different workstreams. Post an update to #core-infra about our streaming infrastructure progress, and update the topic there to reflect our virtual festival focus.

There's also an outdated message I posted earlier that needs deleting, and I need to correct some information in a previous update I sent. Can you help me sort all this out?

_step_sequence.justification: Share findings or coordinate with team

tests.name: Pierogi vs Varenyky Debug Session
tests.prompt:
Hey, I need your help coordinating something for our Polish-Ukrainian debugging session today. We're calling it the "Pierogi vs Varenyky Debug Session" because Olena and Sophie are bringing food during our break!

First, can you check on Sophie Dubois and Olena Petrenko's profiles? I want to make sure I have their roles right when I introduce them to the rest of the team. Also, I need to catch up on what's been happening in the engineering channel - there were some login issues discussed that might be relevant.

Could you find any channels that might already be discussing this topic, and if there isn't a dedicated space yet, please create a new channel for our pierogi-vs-varenyky session? We should also post a heads-up in core-infra about our debugging plans.

Oh, and Aisha left a great message earlier that I want to react to with a thumbs up. Also, I need to remove someone from one of our project channels who's no longer on the team. Thanks!

Verify their role in ML engineering

tests.name: Traditional Tea Ceremony Planning
tests.prompt:
Hey, I need some help organizing our cross-cultural tea ceremony exchange between the Tokyo and Paris offices. Can you set up a dedicated channel for this traditional tea ceremony planning initiative and make sure the channel topic clearly explains what it's about?

Before we get started, I want to check what's been happening in #random lately - there was some casual conversation about lunch plans and something about Gemini that might be relevant to who's interested. Also, take a look at #growth because I remember seeing some Reddit strategy discussion that could tie into how we promote this cultural exchange.

I posted a few messages earlier about the event that need updating with corrected information - the dates and details have changed. There's also one outdated message I sent that's no longer relevant and should just be removed entirely to avoid confusion.

Oh, and if you see the message where Priya or Mateo showed interest in participating, can you add a reaction to acknowledge it? I don't want to clutter the thread with another reply.

_step_sequence.action: Set channel topic about Traditional Tea Ceremony Planning

_step_sequence.justification: Gather context about Gemini discussion, lunch, casual

_step_sequence.action: Update a previous message with new info

_step_sequence.justification: Gather context about Growth metrics, Reddit strategy

tests.name: Cricket World Cup Watch Party
tests.prompt:
Hey, I need your help organizing a Cricket World Cup watch party for our office! We've got team members spread across India, UK, and Australia timezones, so this needs some coordination.

First, can you check what channels we already have that might be relevant to this kind of event? I want to make sure we're not duplicating efforts. Also, I remember someone posted about bringing chai for team gatherings a while back - can you find that conversation? Might be useful for planning refreshments.

I think we should create a dedicated channel for the watch party coordination. Once that's set up, update the topic so people know what it's for. I also need to reach out to Priya Sharma directly since she handles infrastructure and we'll need her help with the streaming setup across offices.

Can you pull up our team roster so I can see who else might want to be involved? Oh, and I sent a few messages earlier about potential dates that had wrong timezone info - please fix those, and there's one completely outdated message about a cancelled venue that should just be deleted entirely.

Thanks!
